nodes.bodyText: add a test case with SELECT * -- the 1 from the scalar subquery should be pulled up and cross join still eliminated.
But in case SELECT *  -- then we might not be able to pull up now. We need something like a EqualityInference for ProjectExpressions which I guess we don't have rn.
Right. You can add a commented out test case, with TODO https://github.com/prestosql/presto/issues/2480 -- #2480.
Should we care about cases where sAtMost(some, context.getLookup(), 0))?
if it has 0 rows then we can replace the join with an empty values node..the same can be extended for other join also.
Right. It can be a separate rule (and separate PR), since this will apply to inner and left/right.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -428,7 +429,8 @@ public PlanOptimizers(
                         estimatedExchangesCostCalculator,
                         ImmutableSet.of(
                                 new RemoveRedundantIdentityProjections(),
-                                new PushAggregationThroughOuterJoin())),
+                                new PushAggregationThroughOuterJoin(),
+                                new RemoveRedundantCrossJoin())),

nodes.bodyText: Initially we have aaded in L#310 but expression in the scalar query gets translated to the probe side of the join after we run the PredicatePushDown optimizer so added it along with RemoveRedundantIdentityProjections

nodes.bodyText: Yeah, ideally all rules should be in the same IterativeOptimizer, unless they cause the optimizer to take a greedy step it won't be able to get out of (such as how Intersect and Except are converted to a combination of joins and aggregations).
